result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy J Wren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol (maintain absolute sobriety). Defendant shall submit to random screens to determine compliance of absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent. Defendant shall provide DNA sample.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy J Wren

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty. Statements by Atty. Bensen. Statements by Atty. Armbrust. Court proceeds to sentencing.
Plea hearing on April 21, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Counsel has provided counter-offer to State, but has not heard back; adj requested.  If not resolved at next hearing, trial will be set.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Plea hearing on March 23, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark David Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Pretrial held, however, counsel has new information to provide to DA and req adj.  Court adj ONE LAST TIME.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Counsel has not rec'd offer and req adj.  Def missed previous appearing due to having car trouble.  Matter to resolve at next hearing or be set for trial.  Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Atty Alyssa Armbrust appearing for Def.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Defendant's car wouldn't start, hasn't been able to get a ride.  No pretrial offer received, matter has been discussed w/ the defendant; Court authorizes and stays a warrant for the defendat.  Hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Absolute sobriety; No violent contact wtih JP

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Alyssa Armbrust of State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $1000 signature bond.  SPD to represent.  Hearing scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
